It had been two weeks since the goddesses started\nliving at Tsubaki.%K%P
Akane still got into fights with Inori now and then,\nbut she was causing a lot less blackouts.%K%P
And little by little, she was getting used to living\nlike a regular human.%K%P
'Ooh, we've got idols coming to town.\nAnd there's gonna be a festival!\nThat'll be fun.'%K%P
'Akane, it's bad form to lie down right\nafter a meal.'%K%P
By now I was used to seeing Akane lying on the\nfloor reading flyers while Inori tried to\nlecture her.%K%P
It had worried me at first, but now it was just\npart of our everyday routine.\nThey were settling in just fine.%K%P
'Who cares, it's only the three of us here.'%K%P
'You're a goddess, you should have a little\nmore decorum.'%K%P
Inori would usually have let it slide,\nbut not today.%K%P
'Come on, you really should get up.'%K%P
'Urgh...fine. Here, how's this?'%K%P
Akane reluctantly refrained from starting a fight\nand simply walked out of the room.%K%P
She was starting to take notice of Inori's\ninstructions.%K%P
That was all well and good, but lately I'd started to\nnotice a hint of irritation in Akane's behavior.%K%P
Maybe she was just keeping her rage bottled up?\nIt didn't look that way, but still...%K%P
'Inori, it seems like you're being a little harder\non her than usual.'%K%P
'Really...? You might be right.\nI'll apologize later.'%K%P
Thinking over her actions, Inori's face clouded over.%K%P
'Uh, is something wrong?'%K%P
'Actually, my boss got in touch to say that we\nneed to pick up the pace.'%K%P
'I've been trying not to let it get to me, but it\nlooks like I let my frustration get the better of\nme after all.'%K%P
So that's how it was.%K%P
Inori must have been worried that we might\nrun out of time.%K%P
Having those fears confirmed by her boss\ncouldn't have helped.%K%P
'That's understandable... But we have to stay calm.\nTrying to rush things won't get us anywhere.'%K%P
'You are right, of course. My apologies for\ngetting carried away.'%K%P
She was right about one thing though, reaching our\ngoal by the deadline was going to be tight.%K%P
But Akane's rehabilitation was coming along smoothly.%K%P
I felt sure there was no need to hurry.%K%P
'Out of my way, it's starting!'%K%P
Akane dashed back into the room and switched the\nTV to a show she wanted to watch.%K%P
'Inori, it seems like you're being a little harder\non her than usual.'%K%P
My hand froze halfway to the door\nwhen I heard Sho's voice.%K%P
'Really...? You might be right.\nI'll apologize later.'%K%P
I'd thought Inori was acting weird.%K%P
She doesn't usually get so huffy over little things.%K%P
So there was actually a reason behind it all.%K%P
'Uh, is something wrong?'%K%P
'Actually, my boss got in touch to say that we\nneed to pick up the pace.'%K%P
Pick up the pace? What was that supposed to mean?%K%P
I'd been holding myself back so much lately,\nwhat more did they want?%K%P
'But... But I'm...'%K%P
I'm doing my best. I wanted to tell them that.%K%P
Before I knew it, I was heading back to my room.%K%P
It was the day after Inori had spoken to her boss.%K%P
'Morning.'%K%P
'Morning, Sho.'%K%P
'Good morning, Sho.'%K%P
Inori and Maika were around, like always.%K%P
The dining table was all laid out, ready for us\nto begin breakfast.%K%P
Something was different this morning, though.%K%P
'Hm? Where's Akane?'%K%P
Everyone else was in their usual seats, but there\nwas no sign of Akane.%K%P
Sure, she slept in sometimes, but she'd never\nmissed a meal before...%K%P
'Why, I haven't seen her yet this morning.'%K%P
'Me neither. Is she still asleep, maybe?'%K%P
'She's been getting up pretty early these days...'%K%P
'Everyone's entitled to a lazy morning now and then.\nShe probably won't be long now.'%K%P
'Perhaps I should go wake her up.'%K%P
Inori stood and was about to leave the room.%K%P
'Wait up, I'll go with you.'%K%P
I had a feeling if I left the two of them alone\nthings would just degenerate into one of their\nusual arguments.%K%P
'Oh, thank you for offering to help.'%K%P
'Good luck, both of you.'%K%P
'Heeey, Akane! It's morning! Breakfast is ready!'%K%P
I reached Akane's door and called out to her.%K%P
I had to knock and yell several times before\nshe finally opened up the door.%K%P
'Cool, you're awake. Like I said, breakfast is ready,\ngo get dressed.'%K%P
'Nah, I'm good.'%K%P
'Akane?'%K%P
She was normally so enthusiastic about food.\nSomehow this didn't bode well.%K%P
Inori seemed to pick up on my concerns\nand stepped forward.%K%P
'Akane, such a sleepy state of being doesn't\ndo you credit.'%K%P
It was the kind of thing Inori said all the time,\nbut on hearing it, Akane's expression turned sour.%K%P
'Well, who cares?\nIf I want to sleep all day,\nthat's my business.'%K%P
Her tone was harsh, completely different from\nher usual manner.%K%P
Inori looked shaken, but she didn't back down.%K%P
Unfortunately...%K%P
'That won't do, you know. Sleeping in too long\nmeans no breakfast, not to mention the effect it\ncould have on our rehabilitation efforts.'%K%P
Bouncing back from the surprise,\nInori launched into lecture mode.%K%P
'Oh, right, rehabilitation...\nWhy don't we just give up on that?'%K%P
'Huh? What do you mean?'%K%P
'I mean give up on it.\nI don't want to do this anymore.\nThe idol stuff, too. Just drop it.'%K%P
I was stunned into silence.%K%P
'Wh-What are you talking about?\nYou've been trying so hard up until now!'%K%P
'Well, like I said, I don't care anymore. It's over.'%K%P
'I can't accept that!\nAt least give me some reason--'%K%P
'Urgh, shut up already! I quit, okay?\nNow leave me alone!'%K%P
Akane slammed her door shut, bringing an\nabrupt end to the conversation.%K%P
All Inori and I could do was stand there,\ntrying in vain to process it all.%K%P
I spent the rest of the day spacing out in my room,\nwishing the uneasy atmosphere would lift somehow.%K%P
'Akane...'%K%P
She still hadn't come out of her room.%K%P
I'd knocked on her door again and again,\neven tried luring her out with her favorite food,\nall to no avail.%K%P
I had an idea as to why she was acting this way.%K%P
Maybe all her training was finally taking its toll. \nMabybe she had just ran out of patience.%K%P
Even so...%K%P
'She looked like she was really enjoying it...'%K%P
Akane sure complained a lot, but she seemed so full\nof life during these past couple of weeks.%K%P
Sure, the road to becoming an idol wasn't easy.\nThere were all kinds of obstacles to overcome.%K%P
But Akane had gone through it all with a smile.%K%P
I couldn't bring myself to think of that as\nanything but genuine.%K%P
'What am I supposed to do...'%K%P
I tried to come up with solutions, but before I knew\nit the sun had gone down and I hadn't come up with\nanything.%K%P
